instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00239 No image after water damage
threads.message:
Hi, 

Got 820-00239 with water damage. Have already repaired all main rails and now machine starts but still no image. I dont have for now usb-c to hdmi so can check if external display is working. 


Checked EDP area and EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN is missing and than PANEL_P5V_EN and PANEL_P3V3_EN are 0 too. All tests are done with good  lcd conected. 


I see that EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN is coming from CPU. 


Any suggestion ?

threads.title: 820-00239 No image after water damage
threads.message:
Was the liquid spill clos to backlight pin of J8500?
In such case, CPU video output is dead...

threads.title: 820-00239 No image after water damage
threads.message:
No, Not that area. FPC was perfect. 

P.S. if cpu video output is dead also will be same for external monitor?

threads.title: 820-00239 No image after water damage
threads.message: Just now it gives me about EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN  give me 6V  PANEL_P5V_EN  5V but display was still black with no backlight. My last boards are all with this kind of shitty  intermittent issues.

threads.title: 820-00239 No image after water damage
threads.message:
Possibly crap under BGA chips.
Use good flux and heat them.
Worst thing if some data lines have got overvoltage from 5V, 13V, or even backlight output...
Liquid spill on the new boards (where Apple didn't start to solder chips one on top of other yet) is a nightmare.
